subtitle: Tell your health worker
title: Who shall I tell?
content:
Created by BabyCenter

Some women want to keep their pregnancy a secret at first. 

But going to the clinic does not mean you have to tell everyone else. 

Talking about being pregnant with a health worker will be good for you and your baby. It will mean fewer problems if you get the right care early on.

You can have tests to make sure that you and your baby are healthy. You can have blood and urine (pee) tests, and tests for HIV. 

If you know you are living with HIV, you can get free medication to prevent your baby from becoming HIV+. 

Even if you feel well, get regular check-ups so that you and your baby can stay healthy.
